title: HTML Introduction
summary: Learn the basics of HTML structure, tags, and elements.
description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of web development. In this lesson, you'll learn about HTML structure, basic tags, elements, attributes, and how to create your first webpage.

slides.title: What is HTML?
slides.content:
What is HTML?

HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of web development.

It's the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications.

HTML provides the structure and content of web pages.

slides.title: HTML Structure
slides.content:
HTML Structure

HTML describes the structure of a web page using markup.

<h1>Hello World</h1>

slides.title: HTML Elements and Tags
slides.content:
HTML Elements and Tags

HTML elements are the building blocks of HTML pages.

  • Elements are represented by tags
  • Most elements have opening and closing tags
  • Some elements are self-closing

This is a paragraph.

learningObjectives: Understand what HTML is and its purpose
Learn basic HTML structure and syntax
Identify HTML elements, tags, and attributes

exercise.description: Create a simple webpage with headings, paragraphs, links, images, and proper HTML structure.
exercise.starter:
Welcome to My Website!

This is my first paragraph.
hints: Use h1 for main headings and h2 for subheadings
Always include alt attributes for images
Use a tags for links with href attributes
Add comments to explain your code

title: CSS Introduction
summary: Learn CSS basics, including selectors, properties, and styling techniques.
description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) controls the visual appearance of web pages. Learn about CSS syntax, selectors, properties, and how to apply styles to your HTML.

slides.title: What is CSS?
slides.content:
What is CSS?

CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

It controls the visual presentation of HTML elements.

CSS lets you create beautiful and responsive web designs.

slides.title: CSS Syntax
slides.content:
CSS Syntax

CSS rules have a selector and declarations:

h1 { color: blue; font-size: 24px; }

slides.title: CSS Selectors
slides.content:
CSS Selectors

Selectors target HTML elements to style:

  • Element selectors: h1, p, div
  • Class selectors: .class-name
  • ID selectors: #element-id

learningObjectives: Understand what CSS is and its purpose

exercise.description: Style a webpage using various CSS techniques.
